forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 46. Northwest wind 5 to 9 mph.

forecast.name: Christmas Day
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 55, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. Northwest wind 3 to 7 mph.

weather_report:
As the clock quietly ticks toward midnight on this Christmas Eve in Downtown San Francisco, the air carries a crispness that hints at the tranquility of the coming holiday. The night remains mostly clear, revealing a softly twinkling cityscape accented by the comforting glow of distant lights. While the temperature lingers around the chilly mid-forties, the gentle northwest winds whisper through the streets, reminding passersby of the subtle dance between warmth and coolness inherent in the San Francisco climate.

Looking ahead to Christmas Day, a promise of mostly sunny skies beckons, with a high near fifty-five. The morning will invite the sun to break free from its evening slumber, while by afternoon, temperatures will gracefully descend to around fifty-three. With winds light and mellow, it appears to be an inviting day to don a warm yet breathable jacket, perhaps layered over a cozy sweater. As you step into the day, consider a stroll through Golden Gate Park or a leisurely visit to a quiet café, where the aroma of fresh coffee mingles with the spirit of the season. While fog may appear at times along the coast, it should stay at bay for most, leaving room for the local charm and holiday spirit to flourish.
